tixclone.title: Tix.vn Clone
tixclone.description: My Personal Website, React.js, Sass, Styled Components

content.text: This is my first big project I've ever made since I got into this industry. CyberSoft (the academy where I learnd to code) gave me some backend APIs, so I didn't have to pay much attention to the backend (but sometimes I had to use mockAPI.io for some part that did't have any API link for it). Because it is the first time I build a large website like this, by my self (only me participated in this project), it took me nearly 2 months to complete it (eat and sleep with it). I had tried lots of CSS frameworks, the more I research the more I confured because of the variety of CSS frameworks. And so far I decided to stick with SASS and Styled-Components. These two frameworks are very powerful and easy to use. Some of the most difficult parts I faced along the way is customization and responsiveness. When I finished the homepage, I realized that I hadn't checked its layout on different size screens. So I had to rebuild it all again, it's a pain in the a**. When there was only 2 days left before the deadline, I had to customize all the code that I wrote. I have to be honest with you that I sometimes don't understand the code that I had written, so after that time I noted a lot above the code that I wrote and tried to code as clear as possible.

Overall, I am very proud of this project. I also really enjoyed programming in React (especially React Hooks system). With the rise of other Componies using React as well as NextJS, I will definitely use it for most of my future projects.
This is the project for my parsonal website.

Originally, I planned to write it using just HTML/CSS/JS. But after doing some research, I realized that being able to create React applications with Typescript are very important and useful. So I learned Typescript and apply it with React to build this project.

One of the challenges I faced was designing the website to be easy to navigate as well as appealing to users. Design is not something I had prior industry experience with so I had to do some research into designing user-friendly and intuitive interfaces.

Another challenge was the overly complicated typing system of Typescript, but its benefits are very attractive once I get used to it (code completion, type checking,...). It prevents me from getting any potential errors, which is so nice. I think from now on I will use Typescript instead of Javascript for React
This is the first time I try Socket.io, and I pretty enjoy it. I think I will stick with it in some other projects in other to understand it better.
This app allows users to create and join multiple rooms at the same time. Anyone in the same room can see and chat to each other.
Users new join to a room won't see messages that were sent before the time they joined. Users in separate rooms cannot view each other's messages.
I do not own this css file. All these CSS of this website come from this source: 'https://gist.github.com/andrewjmead/4783dec59ba2d1e5bcf3e1c301c5858d'
